qas.question: What do Eleonora's falcon feed their young?
What preys on nocturnal passerine migrants?
What makes birds prone to parasites and pathogens?

context: These advantages offset the high stress, physical exertion costs, and other risks of the migration. <a0_0>Predation<a0_0/> can be heightened during migration: Eleonora's falcon Falco eleonorae, which breeds on <a1_0>Mediterranean islands<a1_0/>, has a very late breeding season, coordinated with the autumn passage of <a2_0>southbound passerine migrants<a2_0/>, which it feeds to its young. A similar strategy is adopted by <a3_0>the greater noctule bat<a3_0/>, which preys on nocturnal passerine migrants. The <a4_0>higher concentrations of migrating birds<a4_0/> at stopover sites make them prone to parasites and pathogens, which require a heightened immune response.
